title: Top Lane Mains... Why do you do it?
body:
I'm genuinely curious. What motivates you to play top lane? Is it driven by your champion pool? Is there something about the role that calls out to you?

Top lane feels like the most frustrating role on the map. It very rarely feels like the true 1v1 that it could be, but instead is dependent on pressure from jg/mid to secure kills or blow sums that will lead to kills later in the game. There's nothing worse than trying to farm under tower all game while your own jg seems to forget that top lane exists all together.

I main jungle and always attempt a lvl 3 gank top lane if it looks even remotely possible that at the very least I can burn an enemy flash, because I understand how easy it is to snowball from the slightest advantage.

So Top Lane mains, I want to get inside your head. Why do you prefer that role?

EDIT: Wow! Thanks everyone for the outpouring of response and insight. To think that this thread was being down-voted when I first made it.

Follow-up question: Who are some safe Top Lane picks? Champions that won't fall off hard if they don't get ahead early or can safely farm/scale up even when facing a lot of enemy pressure?

replies.body:
Many reasons:

1. Rarely do people blame you for their own problems: "omg lee y dont u gank?" "gg lulu didn't get any vision" "omg vayne y didn't u follow up?" "fuk u zed no ping mia" What is the top lane equivalent of that? Nothing. Nobody expects shit from you

2. Large amount of diversity. Squishmasters to full tanks, AD, AP, Mobile, slow as fuck. All kinds of shit

3. I don't have to give half a shit about you nerds down there

4. Jungle invasions are like going to an outdoor movie. Pull up the folding chairs and bust out the popcorn, and watch "Jungle Invasion 3: Return of Lee sin"

5. You don't have to rely on anyone else

6. Vision changes hurt you significantly less than other roles

And more, what other questions can I answer?
Have you ever done the most dickish thing you can do to the enemy jungler and kill them at their starting buff with ignite?

No.

But as a support main, I've done it with a stun.
Then stole their blue buff.

. . . Bot lane got ganked a *lot* that game. XD
I've done it as Shyvanna.... not with ignite, but with flat out damage.... Shaco really needs help.....
If the Shaco is any decent, He returned the favor at *your* next buff.

Best way to counter Riven is let her push. Then watch as she grows bored and denied as you freeze the wave under your turret.
If you let her push enough, and only AFK farm under your tower,  her E-penis will explode, and she will try to show her m4d sk1ll and attempt to dive you.

At that stage, start toying with the mind of the Riven player. Start playing ring around the rosies with the turret being your center point of rotation, casually sidestep Riven's attempts to kill you, and apply CC gently when the Riven player realizes that their efforts were in vain. Then, as you get the kill and level up, buy armor. Return to lane and begin with the application of disrespect and BM. Soon the Riven player will get fed up and give up all hope on the game, rendering the game an easily won 4v5.

I enjoy top for 2 reasons.

First, there is a huge variety of champs you can play top. Sure, they might not be meta, but literally every champ can work top if you have the proper skill. 

Secondly, it is the place where i feel like im having a skillful match. Jungle is too dependent on your team not feeding too fast. Botlane is decided by supports and how much your adc trusts said supp. Midlane is too crowded, with literally everyone having the ability to roam mid at a moments notice.

Toplane is different. For the most part, its just you, and your enemy. You win or lose depending on who can capitalize on whos mistakes harder. To me, thats exetremly fun. Im not depending on the hope that my labe isnt invaded or hoping my lane partner doesnt fuck up. Ita jsut me, and tge enemy, and the better player will win (except vs ryze and or irelia. Screw those guys)

Honestly, top feels like a "battle of advantages" lane. Mid is all about reaction time and direct outplay or die. Bot is annoying, dependent on some idiot you got paired with. Jungle is all about macro play, deciding each moment what the best move is. But top really feels like you're outplaying the opponent on a much broader strategic level instead of simple reaction times.

Most champions in top lane are melee bruisers/tanks (if you play vayne/quinn/teemo top, go die in a fire). These champions have decent damage and good tankiness early, so they're not going to insta-kill each other early. As a result, you end up looking for little advantages constantly. Because it's an island, you usually have only yourself to rely on for winning the lane. It's a pure 1v1. Every little advantage you can eek out sticks because there's little else they can fall back on. In mid you play aggressive and dodge their skillshots. Because top has few of those flying around, it's all about positioning right to win every trade possible. Frequently in high elo, those trades never actually happen as both top laners know at all times who will win an trade in a given situation, and the losing party avoids it. In low elo, it's more fun because they don't actually avoid every fight possible.

Essentially, top is about setting yourself up to win every 1v1 situation possible through tactical play and intelligent trading. Poke doesn't exist, you will almost always take damage back in any situation. It's just a matter of skill and tactics. That's fun to me, it's the purest lane, with heavier consequences due to lethal mistakes meaning you have to go back to lane still 1v1 with the enemy now really scary, but depending on your champion, rarely completely dooming the lane. You just have to be smarter. (as opposed to those midlaners who just have to dodge things to win trades. Maybe more mechanical skill, but less tactical skill).
